text: To put this in a context, my first job out of college was a Marine Officer. We got paid well. It didn't get paid great. The point being is the savings rate here is sliding scale based on what you're able to produce. You might look at this if you're in your late teens saying, holy crap, that's more than I make an entire year in general. How can I possibly save that? Well, there's a few different things we could do to accelerate this, but just know, this is on average. Ideally, as your income grows, your savings rate should also grow exponentially with it. So in this case, if you can maintain a really good savings rate early and then as your earnings potential grows, you start getting bonuses. You're not going out and getting bottle service. You're saving. And if you do that early on, you can walk away with a much better average monthly savings in this. I certainly have.

metadata.title: The UGLY Truth About Day Trading to Get Rich
